IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ASSIST THE ARIZONA BOARD OF REGENTS FOR AND ON BEHALF OF THE UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA
IRS990.MissionDesc: CAMPUS RESEARCH CORPORATION OPERATES SOLELY TO ASSIST THE ARIZONA BOARD OF REGENTS, A BODY CORPORATE AND AN AGENCY OF THE STATE OF ARIZONA, TO ENHANCE AND FURTHER THE EDUCATIONAL AND RESEARCH MISSION OF THE UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA.
IRS990.Desc: CAMPUS RESEARCH CORPORATION WAS FORMED IN 1994 TO ASSIST THE ARIZONA BOARD OF REGENTS IN THE MARKETING, LEASING, DEVELOPMENT, IMPROVEMENT, AND OPERATION OF THE UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY PARK LOCATED IN THE TUCSON, ARIZONA METROPOLITAN AREA. IN ADDITION TO USING A PORTION OF THE PARK AS AN EDUCATIONAL FACILITY FOR STUDENTS AND FACULTY OF THE UNIVERSITY, THE CORPORATION LEASES PORTIONS TO PRIVATE INDUSTRY AND GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES. THE PARK PROVIDES A CAMPUS WHERE INDUSTRY AND THE UNIVERSITY CAN PARTICIPATE IN ACTIVITIES THAT PROMOTE AND SUPPORT EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE REGION. THE PARK ALSO PROVIDES A MECHANISM TO PROMOTE THE DEVELOPMENT AND INTEGRATION OF TECHNOLOGICAL RESULTS FROM RESEARCH INTO PRIVATE CORPORATE PROGRAMS. THE TECH PARK SITS ON 1,267 ACRES IN SOUTHEAST TUCSON, ARIZONA. ALMOST 2 MILLION SQUARE FEET OF SPACE HAS BEEN DEVELOPED FEATURING HIGH TECH OFFICE, RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT AND LABORATORY FACILITIES ON 296 ACRES. THE TECH PARK ALSO DEVELOPED A SOLAR RESEARCH FACILITY WHICH IS ON APPROXIMATELY 223 ACRES. THE TECH PARK IS BEING FURTHER DEVELOPED WITH POTENTIAL PROJECTS THAT INCLUDE A HOTEL, CONFERENCE CENTER AND RETAIL AND RESIDENTIAL DEVELOPMENTS THAT WOULD SUPPORT THE OCCUPANTS OF THE TECH PARK.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE UA TECH PARK AT THE BRIDGES IS SITUATED ON 65 ACRES IN CENTRAL TUCSON, ARIZONA. IT'S PART OF A LARGER 350 ACRE MULTI-USE DEVELOPMENT. THE BRIDGES IS PLANNED TO HAVE A UNIVERSITY EDUCATIONAL FACILITY FOR STUDENTS AND FACULTY OF THE UNIVERSITY, THE CORPORATION LEASES PORTIONS TO PRIVATE INDUSTRY AND GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES. THE PARK PROVIDES A CAMPUS WHERE INDUSTRY AND THE UNIVERSITY CAN PARTICIPATE IN ACTIVITIES THAT PROMOTE AND SUPPORT EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE REGION.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART IV, SECTION A, LINE 2
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: CAMPUS RESEARCH CORPORATION SUPPORTS THE ARIZONA BOARD OF REGENTS AND THE UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA. THE ARIZONA BOARD OF REGENTS IS THE GOVERNING BODY OF ARIZONA'S PUBLIC UNIVERSITY SYSTEM. THE UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA IS A STATE UNIVERSITY. BOTH SUPPORTED ORGANIZATIONS ARE GOVERNMENTAL UNITS AND THEREFORE ARE ORGANIZATIONS DESCRIBED UNDER SECTION 509(A)(1) AS ORGANIZATIONS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 170(B)(1)(A)(V).

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART IV, SECTION D, LINE 3
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: THERE ARE EITHER 9, 11 OR 13 MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF CAMPUS RESEARCH CORPORATION. 1 MEMBER IS APPOINTED BY THE CHAIR OF ABOR, AND EITHER 3, 4 OR 5 MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED BY THE PRESIDENT OF U OF A, DEPENDING ON IF THE TOTAL NUMBER OF MEMBERS IS 9, 11 OR 13. THEREFORE, ABOR AND U OF A HAVE SIGNIFICANT VOICES ON THE BOARD. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS APPROVES THE INVESTMENT POLICY, CAPITAL PLAN AND OPERATING BUDGET, AND IS PROVIDED BUDGET-TO-ACTUAL REPORTS MONTHLY.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART IV, SECTION E, LINE 1C
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: CAMPUS RESEARCH CORPORATION WAS FORMED IN 1994 TO ASSIST THE ARIZONA BOARD OF REGENTS IN THE MARKETING, LEASING, DEVELOPMENT, IMPROVEMENT, AND OPERATION OF PORTIONS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY PARK LOCATED IN THE TUCSON, ARIZONA METROPOLITAN AREA. IN ADDITION TO USING A PORTION OF THE PARK AS AN EDUCATIONAL FACILITY FOR STUDENTS AND FACULTY OF THE UNIVERSITY, THE CORPORATION LEASES PORTIONS TO PRIVATE INDUSTRY AND GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES. THE PARK PROVIDES A CAMPUS WHERE INDUSTRY AND THE UNIVERSITY CAN PARTICIPATE IN ACTIVITIES THAT PROMOTE AND SUPPORT EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE REGION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ASC 740 FOOTNOTE: CRC IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER BOTH FEDERAL (INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3)) AND ARIZONA INCOME TAX LAWS, AND IS CLASSIFIED AS OTHER THAN A PRIVATE FOUNDATION UNDER IRC 509(A)(3). UACI, UACI-OV AND UACI-B2 ARE SINGLE MEMBER LLCS AND ARE TREATED AS DISREGARDED ENTITIES FOR TAX PURPOSES. ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISION FOR FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES IS MADE. INCOME FROM CERTAIN ACTIVITIES NOT DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE, HOWEVER, MAY BE SUBJECT TO TAXATION AS UNRELATED BUSINESS TAXABLE INCOME (UBTI). FROM TIME TO TIME, THE ORGANIZATION MAY BE SUBJECT TO PENALTIES AND INTEREST ASSESSED BY VARIOUS TAXING AUTHORITIES, WHICH WILL BE CLASSIFIED AS MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES, IF THEY OCCUR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CAROL STEWART, ELIZABETH CANTWELL, ROBERT SMITH, MARVIN SLEPIAN AND GARTH PERRY ARE ALL UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA PERSONNEL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ARTICLE 4.01 OF THE BYLAWS WAS AMENDED TO REVISE THE NUMBER OF DIRECTORS FROM 13 TO EITHER 9, 11 OR 13, AS DETERMINED BY THE DIRECTORS AT THE ANNUAL MEETING OF THE BOARD. IF NOT SO DETERMINED, THE NUMBER WILL BE THE SAME AS FOR THE IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING 12-MONTH PERIOD. THE TYPES OF DIRECTORS ARE STILL AT LARGE DIRECTORS, UNIVERSITY DIRECTORS, AND ONE REGENTS DIRECTOR, BUT THE CHAIR'S MEMBER WAS REMOVED. THE NUMBER OF EACH TYPE OF DIRECTOR DEPENDS ON THE TOTAL NUMBER OF DIRECTORS OF THE BOARD. * IF THERE ARE 9 DIRECTORS, 5 MUST BE AT LARGE DIRECTORS, 3 UNIVERSITY DIRECTORS, AND 1 REGENTS DIRECTOR. * IF THERE ARE 11 DIRECTORS, 6 MUST BE AT LARGE DIRECTORS, 4 UNIVERSITY DIRECTORS, AND 1 REGENTS DIRECTOR. * IF THERE ARE 13 DIRECTORS, 7 MUST BE AT LARGE DIRECTORS, 5 UNIVERSITY DIRECTORS, AND 1 REGENTS DIRECTOR. ARTICLE 4.01(I) WAS ADDED TO STATE THAT VACANCIES AND REPLACEMENTS FOR DIRECTORS MAY BE FILLED OR ELECTED AT ANY OTHER MEETING OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR BY ACTION BY UNANIMOUS CONSENT WITHOUT A MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS COMPRISED OF THIRTEEN PERSONS ("DIRECTORS"). FOUR DIRECTORS ARE APPOINTED BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA AND ARE REFERRED TO AS "UNIVERSITY MEMBERS". ONE DIRECTOR IS A CURRENT MEMBER OF THE ARIZONA BOARD OF REGENTS OR A FORMER MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF REGENTS WHO SERVED ON THE BOARD OF REGENTS AFTER JANUARY 1, 2004, AND IS APPOINTED BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE ARIZONA BOARD OF REGENTS, AND IS REFERRED TO AS THE "REGENTS' MEMBER". ONE DIRECTOR IS APPOINTED BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE ARIZONA BOARD OF REGENTS AND IS REFERRED TO AS THE "PRESIDENT'S MEMBER". SEVEN DIRECTORS ARE SELECTED AT LARGE. DIRECTORS OTHER THAN UNIVERSITY MEMBERS, THE REGENTS' MEMBER AND THE PRESIDENT'S MEMBER ARE ELECTED BY THE INCUMBENT DIRECTORS AT THE ANNUAL MEETING OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, BUT DIRECTORS MAY BE ELECTED TO FILL VACANCIES OR NEWLY CREATED DIRECTOR POSITIONS AT ANY OTHER MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES A DRAFT OF FORM 990 TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW. AFTER THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE FORM, A COPY IS PROVIDED TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IN PLACE AND EACH OFFICER AND DIRECTOR IS REQUIRED TO SIGN AND AGREE TO THE POLICY. THE BOARD REVIEWS THE POLICY ANNUALLY. ON AN ONGOING BASIS, IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS DISCOVERED, THE INDIVIDUAL IS REQUIRED TO NOTIFY THE ORGANIZATION IMMEDIATELY. CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE HANDLED ON A CASE BY CASE BASIS. THE POLICY COVERS CRC EMPLOYEES AND CRC BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT DETERMINES COMPENSATION FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S EXECUTIVE VP/CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER AND ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES. THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA AND THE UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA VICE PRESIDENT FOR RESEARCH, INNOVATION & IMPACT DETERMINE THE COMPENSATION FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT. THE AMOUNT OF COMPENSATION FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT, EXECUTIVE VP/CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER AND ALL EMPLOYEES IS INCLUDED IN THE ANNUAL OPERATING BUDGET, WHICH IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND THE UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA/ARIZONA BOARD OF REGENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. A COPY OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED IN PLACE OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IF REQUESTED.
